other_tests.findings: Narrowing of the orifice of the bronchus to the upper lobe of the left lung, with irregular friable and bleeding mucosa; cytologic examination revealed non–small-cell cancer of the lung.

Protein level in the pleural fluid was 211 g per deciliter (reference range up to 110; blood level, 8.2), lactate dehydrogenase level 214 U per liter (blood level, 154), specific gravity 1.033, and pH 8.0. There were 40,000 red cells and 400 white cells per cubic millimeter. Cytologic examination showed no malignant-tumor cells.
Diffusely increased uptake in T9 and normal uptake throughout the remainder of the osseous skeleton.
Multiple nodules studding the visceral and parietal pleura and the diaphragm; biopsy specimens were obtained.
Biopsy specimens of the T9 vertebral body were obtained.
Revealed an in-frame deletion in exon 19 (2235_2249del), one of the most commonly identified EGFR mutations.

Marked decrease in the size of the mass in the left lung to 2 cm in diameter, with resultant re-aeration of the left upper lobe and near resolution of the pleural fluid and thickening on the left side.
other_tests.changes_over_time: By the eighth month of gefitinib therapy, CT showed new, predominantly pleural and subpleural nodules, though the primary lesion remained suppressed.
